results.title: Fact-Checking the Truth That Donald Trump Promised
results.abstract: Many facts in Mr. Trump’s acceptance speech appear to be true, though he sometimes failed to offer the entire story or provide all of the context.

results.title: Hillary Clinton Selects Tim Kaine, a Popular Senator From a Swing State, as Running Mate
results.abstract: Mr. Kaine, a former governor of Virginia who is now on the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, speaks fluent Spanish and has a strong friendship with Mrs. Clinton.

media.caption: Hillary Clinton campaigned with Senator Tim Kaine of Virginia, in Annandale, Va., last week.

results.title: Gunman in Munich Kills 9, Then Himself, the Police Say
results.abstract: The police said the attack outside a mall was probably the work of a single gunman. At least 21 people were wounded.

results.title: Tim Kaine Seems Likely for Hillary Clinton’s No. 2, but Liberals Balk
results.abstract: Mrs. Clinton’s campaign has kept a tight lid on its search for a vice-presidential candidate but was expected to make her choice known on Friday afternoon.

results.abstract: The women in Donald Trump’s life have sharply different roles. That difference is what many other men want, too.

results.title: Jon Stewart, Back on ‘Late Show,’ Lets Loose on Fox News and More
results.abstract: Jon Stewart appeared on “The Late Show With Stephen Colbert,” delivering a 10-minute monologue on the state of politics.

media.caption: Jon Stewart fiercely criticized the Fox News host Sean Hannity and other TV personalities who he says have bent over backward to support the Republican presidential nominee, Donald J. Trump.

results.byline: By PATRICK HEALY and JONATHAN MARTIN
results.title: His Tone Dark, Donald Trump Takes G.O.P. Mantle
results.abstract: Donald J. Trump accepted the Republican presidential nomination with an unusually vehement appeal to Americans who feel that their country is spiraling out of control.

results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2016;Republican National Convention;Trump, Donald J;Republican Party;Clinton, Hillary Rodham
results.title: Make America Hate Again
results.abstract: Nothing about this Republican Party even remotely resembles the Grand Old Party of before. The convention was all doom, dystopia, dread and darkness.

results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2016;Republican National Convention;Trump, Donald J;Republican Party;Crime and Criminals
results.title: The Dark Knight
results.abstract: Donald Trump’s promise to save us from a malevolent world employs the same argument used by just about every other demagogue since the dawn of time.

results.title: Skinny and 119 Pounds, but With the Health Hallmarks of Obesity
results.abstract: A small group of thin patients who develop disorders typically tied to obesity pose a medical mystery and a potential opportunity for scientists.

media.caption: Claire Walker Johnson, 55, of Queens, developed Type 2 diabetes and a fatty liver, among other problems related to obesity, despite weighing only 119 pounds. She eventually found she had lipodystrophy, a rare genetic disorder.
media.copyright: Andrew White for The New York Times

results.title: Released Emails Suggest the D.N.C. Derided the Sanders Campaign
results.abstract: Some of the nearly 20,000 messages, made public through WikiLeaks, show officials at the Democratic National Committee thought little of Mr. Sanders’ chances of becoming president.

results.title: Escape His Caricature? Donald Trump Passes Up the Chance
results.abstract: To an electorate that remains anxious about his demeanor, his honesty and his character, Mr. Trump offered no acknowledgment, no rebuttal, no explanation.

results.title: Shooting in Munich: What We Know, and What We Don’t
results.abstract: Nine people are killed in a “shooting rampage” in Munich by a lone gunman. The police said the gunman’s body was found less than a mile from the scene of the attack.

results.title: Donald Trump Basks in Convention ‘Love’ (but Has None for Ted Cruz)
results.abstract: After bragging that he had unified Republicans in one of the most “love-filled” conventions in history, the nominee went on an extended diatribe against his primary rival.
